intro: Swertia graciliflora, commonly known as slender-flowered swertia, is a herbaceous plant native to the Himalayas. It typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring cool, moist environments. The plant features delicate, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers clustered in racemes. It belongs to the Gentianaceae family, which is characterized by its showy, often blue or purple flowers. Swertia graciliflora is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to high-altitude conditions.
